channel.title: Question on cookies
channel.description:
I was curious if there was anyway to get a cookie from a diffrent desination then the one that you are on. For example
If you visit www.thisserver.com , can www.thisserver.com request to view a cookie that was created before, or one that is currently being used from www.yourserver.com, If you get my drift
If you wish to know why. I go to myspace, and the past few days i have seen so many fake trackors. It is said to be able to know when people visit your page, and who visits them. And I wanted to see if there was was a way to create one from using cookies.

item.title: Question on cookies
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

XSS(Cross Site Scripting) vulnerabilities are the only way.

Read full topic

item.title: Question on cookies
item.dc:creator: @drugofanewage drugofanewage
item.description:
@drugofanewage wrote:

BobDole81:

Only third party cookies can be read from sites other than the site that created it. However, third party cookies are almost never used by websites to keep a track of relatively personal data, so a general answer to your question is no…

alright, atleast i know this now

thanks alot

Read full topic

item.title: Question on cookies
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Only third party cookies can be read from sites other than the site that created it. However, third party cookies are almost never used by websites to keep a track of relatively personal data, so a general answer to your question is no…

item.title: Question on cookies
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

no dont think so

also… i donno how they know who vists but if they use an image its really ez everytme the image is loaded( each one has a unique id) and that adds a count to a mysql table for that image (aka. urs)

Read full topic
